text: Two hundred and twenty-three incident @DISEASE$ cases and 229 controls recruited from Saudi Arabian population were analyzed for 21 loci in 8 selected DNA repair genes by PCR-restriction fragment length polymorphism including non-homologous end joining pathway genes @GENE$ (LIGlV ASP62HIS, PRO231SER, TRP46TER), XRCC4 Splice 33243301G>A and XRCC7 ILE3434THR; homologous recombination pathway genes XRCC3 ARG94HIS and THR241MET, RAD51 UTR 15452658T>C, 15455419A>G, RAD52 2259 and GLN221GLU, conserved DNA damage response gene Tp53 PRO47SER, PRO72ARG, Tp53 UTR 7178189A>C and base excision repair gene XRCC1 ARG194TRP, ARG280HIS, ARG399GLN, ARG559GLN.

text: @GENE$ genotypes CG and variants carrying G allele showed statistical significance and very high risk of developing @DISEASE$ compared to wild type [CG vs CC; p<0.001, odds ratio (OR)=15.57, 95% confidence interval (CI)=6.56-36.98, CG+GG vs CC; p<0.001, OR=17.58, 95% CI=7.44-41.58].
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]@GENE$[/E1] genotypes CG and variants carrying G allele showed statistical significance and very high risk of developing [E2]@DISEASE$[/E2] compared to wild type [CG vs CC; p<0.001, odds ratio (OR)=15.57, 95% confidence interval (CI)=6.56-36.98, CG+GG vs CC; p<0.001, OR=17.58, 95% CI=7.44-41.58].
text_with_typed_entity_marker: [GENE]@GENE$[/GENE] genotypes CG and variants carrying G allele showed statistical significance and very high risk of developing [DISEASE]@DISEASE$[/DISEASE] compared to wild type [CG vs CC; p<0.001, odds ratio (OR)=15.57, 95% confidence interval (CI)=6.56-36.98, CG+GG vs CC; p<0.001, OR=17.58, 95% CI=7.44-41.58].

text: An anti-inflammatory and anticarcinogenic potential has been inferred from the development of @DISEASE$ and intestinal cancer in @GENE$ and GPx2 double knockout mice.
text_with_entity_marker: An anti-inflammatory and anticarcinogenic potential has been inferred from the development of [E1]@DISEASE$[/E1] and intestinal cancer in [E2]@GENE$[/E2] and GPx2 double knockout mice.

text: An anti-inflammatory and anticarcinogenic potential has been inferred from the development of colitis and @DISEASE$ in @GENE$ and GPx2 double knockout mice.

text: Thus, @GENE$ may prevent undue responses to inflammatory stimuli and, in consequence, inflammation-driven initiation of @DISEASE$.

text: For the remaining markers, a susceptibility role was attributed also confirming that markers on CARD15 gene, in particular @GENE$ and L1007fsinsC, are involved with @DISEASE$ to the same extent as FcGIIIA G559T and TNF-alpha-G308A.

text: The @GENE$ and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with @DISEASE$ in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]@GENE$[/E1] and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with [E2]@DISEASE$[/E2] in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.
text_with_typed_entity_marker: The [GENE]@GENE$[/GENE] and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with [DISEASE]@DISEASE$[/DISEASE] in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.

text: Additionally, the @GENE$ and the NOS1AP genotypes were demonstrated not to have a major influence on @DISEASE$.

text: The C-allele of @GENE$ rs3020781 and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with @DISEASE$ in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.
text_with_entity_marker: The C-allele of [E1]@GENE$[/E1] rs3020781 and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with [E2]@DISEASE$[/E2] in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.
text_with_typed_entity_marker: The C-allele of [GENE]@GENE$[/GENE] rs3020781 and the T-allele of NOS1AP rs7538490 are reported to strongly associate with [DISEASE]@DISEASE$[/DISEASE] in various European-descent populations comprising a total of 2,198 individuals with a combined odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 [1.16-1.54] and 1.53 [1.28-1.81], respectively.

text: We failed to provide evidence of an association between @GENE$ and NOS1AP rs7538490 and @DISEASE$, overweight, obesity or related quantitative metabolic phenotypes in large-scale studies of Danes.
text_with_entity_marker: We failed to provide evidence of an association between [E1]@GENE$[/E1] and NOS1AP rs7538490 and [E2]@DISEASE$[/E2], overweight, obesity or related quantitative metabolic phenotypes in large-scale studies of Danes.
text_with_typed_entity_marker: We failed to provide evidence of an association between [GENE]@GENE$[/GENE] and NOS1AP rs7538490 and [DISEASE]@DISEASE$[/DISEASE], overweight, obesity or related quantitative metabolic phenotypes in large-scale studies of Danes.

text: No significant associations were observed for @DISEASE$ (@GENE$: pAF = 0.49, OR = 1.02 [0.96-1.10]; rs7538490: pAF = 0.84, OR = 0.99 [0.93-1.06]).
text_with_entity_marker: No significant associations were observed for [E1]@DISEASE$[/E1] ([E2]@GENE$[/E2]: pAF = 0.49, OR = 1.02 [0.96-1.10]; rs7538490: pAF = 0.84, OR = 0.99 [0.93-1.06]).

text: Lack of association between @GENE$ and NOS1AP rs7538490 and @DISEASE$, overweight, obesity and related metabolic phenotypes in a Danish large-scale study: case-control studies and analyses of quantitative traits.
